title: Product of Sines
text: The formula to express the product of sine sin(a)sin(b) as a sum or difference is 1/2[cos(a-b)-cos(a+b)].

title: Plug Values into Formula
text: To rewrite the product as a sum or difference, plug the identified values of a and $$b$$ into the formula for the product of sines.

title: Property of Cosine
text: Since all angles in the final answer should be positive, remember the property of cosines that $$cos(-x)=cos(x)$$.
